channel.title: linux on Chaosmatrix
channel.description: Recent content in linux on Chaosmatrix

item.title: [paper review] Fairness and Interactive Performance of O(1) and CFS Linux Kernel Schedulerss
item.description: Abstract For both medium and high load, CFS has higher average latency (5ms ~ 10ms) than O(1). The greater the load, the greater average latency. CFS parameters also has an impact on the average / tail latency. The nice value also has impact of CFS. The lower nice value, the greater time slice. The nice value also has impact of O(1). Review paper: Fairness and interactive performance of O(1) and CFS Linux kernel schedulers
